page.title: 01BRIMFIELD & LITTLE HEREFORD
page.content: The area is situated 6 miles to the north of Leominster and 4 miles south of Ludlow on the A49(T) and extends eastwards towards Tenbury Wells along the A456. The north western square and small ports of surrounding squares are in the county of Shropshire, the remaining squares are in Hereford and Worcester. The River Teme, which flows in a south easterly direction dominates the area. It provides valuable farmland on the valley floor and on its slopes are located the two mainsettlements of the area - Brimfield and Little Hereford. The lowest point in the area is 61m, and the heighest point is approximately 110m. Agriculture is the dominant feature of the area also being the largest employed. A by-pass of Brimfield has recently been opened which has taken the passing trade away
